Chapter on Hell, Part 10
Moreover, that bhiká¹£u observes stealing, which brings much pleasure and the retribution one receives.
He sees, hears, and knows:
Like a whirling fire wheel, a gandharva city, or a mirage, one sees a great heap of wealth and possessions in hell, with gold, pearls, jewels, clothing, and various other things gathered together.
That person of evil karma, having seen this, gives rise to a greedy mind. Deluded by greed and ignorance, such a thought arises:
'That wealth and possessions are my wealth and possessions.'
Such a foolish person, due to his evil karma, passes through a mass of burning flames and runs towards those possessions.
Created by evil karma, the Yama demons then use a sword net to seize that criminal and cut, slash, burn, and destroy all his limbs, leaving only bones.
Since beginningless time, the mind of greed has not been abandoned. One experiences such suffering and still remembers it without forgetting.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
The smoke of arrogance and jealousy, the topknot of discrimination grasping others' things,
The fire of greed burns people, just as worldly fire burns wood.
People bitten by the poison of greed, they are hard to pacify,
Frequently delighting in greed, and it grows even more.
Just as fire obtains fuel, the greedy mind grows like this.
When fire burns people, they can run away, but greed burns and cannot be avoided.
Greedy people revolve like a wheel, and the greedy mind deceives people,
In the world without beginning or end, there is no beginningless enemy of greed.
People deceived by the greedy mind enter the water of the ocean,
Entering the place full of sword tips, they experience it due to the greedy mind.
Because of the causes and conditions of greed, they become kings, killing each other in turn,
Separated from mother and child, united, the beloved objects enter the head.
If one can escape the poison of craving, that person abandons the fire of greed,
If a person treats gold and dirt equally, then they are close to nirvana.
Precepts are the supreme wealth, the sun is the foremost light,
Wealth can be scattered and destroyed, but precepts are always not lost or diminished.
Observing precepts gives birth to the three heavens, and also gives birth to the realm of meditation,
The light of precepts has no equal, in this world and the future world.
If one extinguishes the fire of greed, using wisdom as water,
For one who does not extinguish the greedy mind, liberation is unattainable.
Those hell beings, having been burned by that fire of greed, enter the second fire of AvÄ«ci and fall onto a steep cliff onto sharp blades, being burned three times more intensely.
That hell is like a whirling fire wheel, a gandharva city, or a mirage. Such is the greed for objects, like what is seen in a dream.
The Yama demons seize the hell beings and give them great suffering for countless hundreds of thousands of years, due to the karma of stealing.
Furthermore, that bhiká¹£u observes the fruits of evil actions in AvÄ«ci Hell. He sees:

Thus, the person who has done evil, having escaped from that iron evil place, having passed through the mass of fire, due to the turning of evil karma, enters another place called the place of wrong views.

Due to that evil karma, he sees a woman just like the one he saw before in the human realm, the one he had intercourse with. Having seen her, the fire of desire that has been accumulated since beginningless time arises, and he immediately runs quickly towards that woman.

The woman created by evil karma has an entirely iron body. When she arrives, she embraces the person, kisses their mouth, and eats their lips and so forth, leaving nothing the size of a mustard seed. The body is also eaten, and when it is finished, it grows again. When it grows, it is eaten again. When it is eaten, it grows again. The person thus experiences extremely severe suffering.
The person's desire-fire does not let go. Seeing another woman elsewhere, burned by the fire of desire, he quickly runs towards her, not thinking of the suffering.

The woman has a body of vajra and iron, burning with flames. She embraces the criminal, and upon embracing, he is shattered like a sand ball being crushed. The entire body is scattered, and when scattered, it grows again.
When it grows, it is scattered again. When scattered, it grows again.
He runs again, thus experiencing suffering with an uncertain mind of desire.
The bhiká¹£u sees this place, and hears and knows it in the same way, and speaks a verse, saying:
Women are the root of evil, able to lose all things,
If a person delights in women, happiness cannot be obtained.
Among all dharmas, evil is abundant in women, with much flattery and jealousy,
Because of women, men can lose in both this world and the next.
Women delight in practicing desire, women always engage in deception,
The thoughts in their minds are different, and they speak different words with their mouths.
At first, their words are soft and smooth, but later their hearts are like diamonds,
Neither grateful nor respectful, their minds are light and do not remember.
They do not think of a hundred favors, but calculate a single evil,
Their minds are like a deer's body, women are a ground of evil karma.
Men's minds are stained with desire, women cause men to lose,
In this world and the next, women's loss is the greatest loss.
If one wishes to receive happiness, one should abandon women,
If one abandons women, it is the foremost joy in the world.
If a person wishes to cut off craving and aspire for great wealth and joy,
If one wishes to reach a place of tranquility, one should abandon women.'
Because of their deluded minds, they are burned, cooked, destroyed, and then reborn again for countless hundreds of thousands of years.
If they manage to escape from there, they enter a mass of fire, burned and cooked, tormented by hunger and thirst, running around everywhere.
Moreover, that bhiká¹£u observes that a person of evil who has fully engaged in and frequently engaged in the unwholesome karma of lying experiences the ripening of the results they receive.
He sees, hears, and knows:
The person of lying karma is burned by hunger and thirst in that hell. A powerful Yama-world person seizes that criminal and asks:
'What do you suffer from?'
He replies:
'Hunger and thirst.'
The Yama demons seize the person of accumulated karma and pry open his mouth, pulling out his tongue. Due to the power of evil karma,
such an evil tongue is five yojanas long, the result of lying.

When the tongue is pulled out, the Yama demons take it and place it on a burning iron ground. Due to evil karma, they make a thousand plows. The plow heads are burning with flames. Extremely powerful oxen plow it back and forth a hundred times and a thousand times, coming and going, creating a river of pus and blood with insects in the river.

Moreover, many insects are born in the tongue. The tongue is extremely soft, like the soft heavenly garments. Such a soft tongue is plowed back and forth, and then grows together again. After growing together, it is plowed again.

In this way, for innumerable hundreds of thousands of millions of years, such an evil tongue experiences evil suffering. The evil suffering is severe and unbearable. That person experiences suffering, wailing and crying, alone and without rescue.

Such evil karma is not created by the mother, nor by the father, nor by the gods, nor is it created by any other person, nor is it non-action, nor does it come from elsewhere. It is created by oneself and not lost. If one does not create it, one does not experience the results of the karma.
Thus, when that person experiences suffering and cries out, the Yama demons reprimand him, speaking a verse, saying:
One should abandon the hard and evil, which has no flavor and is false speech.
The person who speaks false speech, their mind is light and will soon be lost.
One will not believe in such a place, and all good people will abandon it.
It is not loved like an enemy, and the strong are able to abandon it.
False speech first deceives oneself, and then deceives others.
If one does not abandon false speech, oneself and others will be destroyed together.
The person who speaks false words first destroys their own mouth,
They will be abandoned by humans and gods, and will eventually go to an evil realm.
If one delights in and enjoys lying, that person has no good place,
In the worldly and transcendent paths, due to lying, one is abandoned.
Lying has a firm retribution, the wise abandon it,
Those who rely on lying, will go to the hells.
The truth-speaker is supreme among humans, all humans make offerings to him,
Lying is abandoned by all, thus one should speak truthfully.
If one does not kill and speaks the truth, with a gentle mind and compassion for beings,
Truth-speaking is the stairway to heaven, truth is the foremost Dharma.
If a person is on the path to hell, in front of the Yama demons,
Due to that cause and condition of lying, the wise speak thus.
Like poison, a snare, or a hook, like a sword or fire,
If one speaks lies, one will receive many bad consequences.
If you wish to seek the fruits of good karma, and wish to see the truth,
You should always speak truthfully, and abandon evil and false speech.

' The hell beings experience such hard and painful suffering. In this way, for countless hundreds of thousands of years, they are plowed with a plow on their tongues. The tongue of the liar returns to the mouth.

The person is terrified, and the mouth and face are torn apart. Running everywhere, they fall into a mass of burning charcoal. Entering, they are burned. The person experiences such great suffering, with no rescue and no refuge.
Moreover, the Yama demons have hands holding sticks and knives. They cause the hell beings, from head to foot, to be completely shattered. They cry out and wail, never ceasing.
The fire of AvÄ«ci always burns extremely hot.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us contemplate the results obtained from enjoying and creating much divisive speech.
They see, hear, and know that the hell beings have the results of the karma of divisive speech:
Due to the cause of divisive speech, they again arrive in the extremely evil hells. There are even more Yamadutas there, who are even more evil. The sinners see them and ask:
'What are you suffering from?'
They reply:
'We are suffering from hunger.'
The Yamadutas then pry open their mouths, pull out their tongues, and hold them in their hands. The tongues are three hundred yojanas long and come out like this.

Those Yamadutas, who are merciless and evil, take flaming iron knives, whose blades are sharp and burning, and cut off one side of the tongues. On that one side of the tongues, there are dogs, jackals, and wolves that eat them. They experience such extremely evil suffering, crying out and wailing with voices that do not cease.
Those hell beings cry out like this. Because the Yamadutas scold them, they speak a verse, saying:
You, with a mind of destruction, have spoken many words,
In all dharmas, there is defilement, and the fruits are cooked like this.
The evil person who speaks divisive words is always solitary in their place of birth.
What person speaks divisively? It is not praised by good people.
In their place of birth, they are always vulgar, born in an evil place.
If a person speaks divisively, they are upheld by delusion.
The person who practices evil karma is always burned by hell.
If a person delights in doing evil, they always speak divisively.
Deceived by the first evil, secret words are not concealed.
The person who speaks divisively, on both sides, always eats the flesh of others' backs.
If a person abandons divisive speech, that person is always firm and secret.
Friends, brothers, and so forth, are never abandoned.ğŸ”½If a person abandons divisive speech, they always protect the king's secret words.
Abandoning divisive speech is tranquil. If a person leaves jealousy and evil,
Why do you not practice the Dharma?
Why did you not abandon divisive speech?
Now you experience the fruits of divisive speech. Why do you feel remorse in your heart?'

The Yama demons thus reprimand the hell beings. Those who experience the suffering of the tongue enter the great ocean of suffering. For countless hundreds of thousands of years, the evil karma of those people
If they escape that place of intense suffering, their tongues return to normal and they no longer see the Yama demons.

Those hell beings, having escaped the suffering in hell, run everywhere in a hurry, experiencing the most intense suffering that is difficult to endure. The power of evil karma blows the fuel of evil retribution, and the great fire burns as they run everywhere in a hurry.
There are again Yama demons who seize them and ask:
'What are you suffering from?'
Due to the causes and conditions of evil karma, they immediately reply:
'I am now suffering from hunger.'
The Yama demons will then pry open their mouths and pull out their tongues, and powerful men will cut them with knives, forcing them to eat them themselves.
Because of their extreme hunger, they will then eat their own tongues, and saliva and blood will flow out.

In this way, they will eat their own tongues. Their tongues will be cut off and then grow back again, cut off and then grow back again, due to the power of karmic bonds. They will roll on the ground, wailing and crying out in distress.

In this way, they will suffer greatly, their eyes rolling and their pupils moving. They will experience immense suffering, alone and without companions, experiencing the consequences of their own actions.
The Yama demons will then rebuke them with these verses:
The tongue is like a bow, and harsh words are like sharp arrows.
If a person speaks harshly, the fruits they receive will be similar.
Just as people avoid those who eat meat,
if a person speaks harshly, their tongue is like poison.
Knives, fire, poison, and other evils, these evils are not great evils,
If a person speaks evil words, this evil is a great evil.
The drill of the tongue can give rise to fire, which grows in the heart,
The fire of evil words among people, like burning dry firewood.
If a person delights in sweet words, all people make offerings to him,
Like his own mother, his mind is delighted like his father.
Sweet words are the foremost good, the cause is joyful and the effect is also joyful,
It can exhaust and remove evil, benefiting all in the world.
Sweet words are the steps to heaven, sweetness is the foremost treasure,
Sweetness is the eye of the world, sweetness is no different from honey.
Evil speech is the foremost evil, having spoken one goes to hell,
You yourself experience the consequences of your tongue, why do you regret it now?'
The Yama people thus rebuke the hell offenders.

After passing through countless hundreds of thousands of years, the evil person who lied and spoke harshly, who enjoyed doing and encouraging others to do such actions, will continue to experience such suffering.
If he escapes from that place, he will run around everywhere, and again the YamadÅ«tas will seize him and burn him, causing him great suffering.
Furthermore, that bhiká¹£u observes frivolous speech, which when enjoyed and done much, has the karmic result of evil.
He sees, hears, and knows:

This hell being himself experiences the karmic result of his own evil actions, suffering extreme pain, the most intense suffering. If he escapes from the YamadÅ«tas in this way, he will run around everywhere, and again he will be seized by other YamadÅ«tas, who will ask him:
'What are you suffering from?'
He will then answer:
'I am suffering from extreme hunger and thirst.'
And he will speak a verse, saying:
'My own merits are exhausted, born from my own drilling,
Iron fire burns, hungry and thirsty, I experience the suffering of evil burning.'
Just as ice and snow in fire, or Mount Sumeru in mustard seeds,
So is the superiority of hunger in hell.
The power of the fire in hell does not extend to other places,
But the fire of hunger and thirst can reach even the heavens.
Thus, in this hell, one experiences other heavy sufferings,
Although these sufferings are heavy, they are not as bad as the suffering of thirst and fire.

' The Yama demons, having heard this, open its mouth with burning iron pincers, and place a burning iron bowl filled with molten copper, hot and boiling, in its mouth. Because of the sin of idle chatter, it burns its tongue, which immediately melts like snow in fire.
The hell being experiences two kinds of suffering, which cannot be fully described. Having been burned like this, it cries out loudly.
Because of the loud shouting, even more molten copper is poured into their mouths. After burning their tongues, it burns their throats;
after burning their throats, it burns their hearts;ğŸ”½after burning their hearts, it burns their intestines;
after burning their intestines, it burns their stomachs;
after burning their stomachs, it exits from below.
Thus, the sinful person suffers and cries out. The Yama demons then speak a verse to reprimand him, saying:ğŸ”½The words are not bound before and after,
meaningless and inappropriate,ğŸ”½you originally spoke frivolously,
and now you receive such fruits.ğŸ”½If one always speaks untruthfully,
and always does not read and recite,ğŸ”½then that is not a tongue,
but only a piece of meat.ğŸ”½If a person always speaks truthfully,
and always delights in good qualities,ğŸ”½then that is the stairway to heaven,
and can be called a tongue.
The Yama demons will thus rebuke the hell beings.

Having rebuked them, they will again pour molten copper liquid into the mouths of the hell beings, for countless hundreds of thousands of years. This is the evil retribution for speaking irrelevant and frivolous words.

If the hell beings manage to escape from the Yama demons, they will run around everywhere, and again enter a mass of fire, where their bodies will melt away. Their legs, thighs, waist, and so forth, in the mass of fire, will all melt away, like a lump of fresh butter. Having melted, they will regenerate.
In this way, the people will seek rescue and protection, running around everywhere. Due to their evil karma, they will see a city in the distance, filled with treasures guarded by others.
In this way, the deluded people, due to the cause of their evil karma, will give rise to greed and run towards those objects, thinking they belong to them.

The person with a greedy mind, due to the evil and unwholesome karma of delighting in and frequently engaging in such actions, will experience the following retribution in hell: their mind will be deluded and they will see things in a distorted manner. Having seen this, due to their greedy mind, they will hope to enjoy many pleasures.

Due to their greedy mind, a knife will appear in their hand. They will rush towards those objects. Having reached the objects, they will use the knife to cut each other. Those hell beings will cut each other like this, leaving only bones behind, and then they will regenerate.
Having regenerated, they will cut each other again. Having cut, they will regenerate again. This will continue for countless hundreds of thousands of years.

The actions of evil karma will cause the Yama demons to seize sharp knives in their hands, skin the hell beings, and cut them all with knives. All the flesh will be gone, not even a mustard seed's worth remaining, leaving only bones behind.
Those hell beings will cry out, wail, grieve, and suffer in agony. They will be cut like this, and after being cut, they will regenerate.

Just as if one were cut with a knife, the henchmen of Yama will place them in the river, and they will immediately come back to life. In this way, the hell beings will revive again, and they will continue to experience suffering, crying out and wailing.
The henchmen of Yama will again speak a verse, reproaching them, saying:
The man destroyed by greed, deceived by greed,
Aspires for the possessions of others, and is thus boiled here.
The greedy mind is evil and unwholesome, the deluded mind delights in it,
The greedy mind burns itself, like fire coming from wood.
The greedy mind is extremely evil, it causes people to reach hell,
Thus one should abandon greed, the poisonous evil thing that brings suffering as retribution.
Having seen others' wealth, with a greedy mind one hopes to obtain it for oneself,
That greed produces poisonous fruits, and one now comes here to receive them.'
The henchmen of Yama thus reprimand the hell beings.

After being reprimanded, they are then given numerous sufferings. In this way, for countless hundreds of thousands of years, until their evil karma is exhausted, the time is long and the suffering is unceasing.

If the hell beings escape from that place, hoping for rescue and refuge, running everywhere, they will again enter a mass of fire, fall into extremely burning hot iron ground, roll around and rise again, running everywhere alone without a companion.
The evil karmic agent, the enemy of evil karma, will lead them into hell. If they can escape the Yama demons, they will run everywhere.

This person, with a mind of anger, happily engages in and creates much. The retribution is now experienced, with no rescue or refuge. Lions, tigers, snakes, and other angry creatures presently stand before them.

The person, in fear, runs here and there, but because of his evil karma he is unable to run, and is caught. With extreme anger, [the demon] first eats his head. Having had his head eaten, he cries out in misery and rolls on the ground. There is also an evil snake whose fangs have terrible poison, which bites him and eats his sides. A tiger eats his back, fire burns his feet, and the Yama demons shoot him from afar. Thus he suffers.
The Yama demons again spoke a verse, reproaching him, saying:
You were burned by anger, the most contemptible among men,
And are now burned here - why do you cry out now?
Anger is the primary cause, causing people to be born in hell,
Like a rope binding you, you now receive this suffering.
The angry mind deceives the foolish, always thinking of anger and not letting go,
The mind has never been tranquil, like a snake dwelling in a hole.
If a person is of a firm and evil nature, always acting with much anger,
That person will not attain happiness, like darkness at midday.
Neither by Dharma nor by much wealth, nor by knowledge, nor by relatives,
Can anyone protect a person whose mind is disturbed by anger.
In this world and the next, it can produce dark and gloomy fruits,
And can lead to an evil place, therefore it is called anger.
The non-angry one is supreme, the angry person is not victorious.
If a person abandons anger, that person will proceed to nirvana.
You, due to the causes and conditions of anger, have reached an evil place, the hells.
Only when your karma is exhausted will you be able to escape. What benefit is there in rolling around?
The Yama demons reprimand the hell beings in this way. Having reprimanded them, they shoot them with arrows again:
Lions, tigers, and other ferocious animals, due to their angry causes, kill and eat each other.
Due to similar karma, they receive similar retribution, because the fruit resembles the seed.

Thus, the evil karmic retribution of such sinners is cooked for a long time. If they escape that place, they run around everywhere seeking rescue and refuge. Due to the evil causes of wrong views and the retribution of the five heinous crimes, they attain such a path and are born in AvÄ«ci Hell.
Thus, the five heinous crimes are definitely experienced there, as similar to the karma.
In what place are those hell beings?
Maba Jia Li, Bu Lan Na, Ti Wen Ta, Ju Jia Li and others are burned and cooked there.
Those hell beings reach the great hell and are definitely burned and cooked, experiencing the most urgent and evil suffering.
What is the suffering there?
All sentient beings cannot give a simile.
Thus, the sinners in AvÄ«ci Hell experience great suffering and distress. The evil karmic actions of those people gather together like a mass of darkness, afflicting all beings.
In the Maoqi Hell above, rain falls like swords.

The people in AvÄ«ci are burned, cooked, split apart, and then reborn again. After being reborn, they are split apart again, split again, burned again, rained upon by vajra hammers, rained upon by vajra hail, and rained upon by rocks, shattered and scattered.
Those who commit the five heinous crimes are burned in this way, and then there are eleven more masses of flames, causing them to experience great suffering that is unbearable.
In the ten directions, there are ten flames, and the eleventh is the mass of fire of hunger and thirst. Because of hunger and thirst, flames emerge from their mouths.
Those people are surrounded by ten flames on all sides, burning and cooking their entire bodies, without any place that is not burned, not even as small as the tip of a hair.
Those sinners are equally burned, not even a hair's breadth of pleasure, thus it is called AvÄ«ci, up to not even a trace of pleasure, thus it is called AvÄ«ci.
All faculties and all objects are all cooked, because of the incorrect mind it is called AvÄ«ci.
Falling from this world, there is no other place to be born, only born there.
In the great hells, suffering has no further excess, the time is countless, thus it is called AvÄ«ci.
All sentient beings included in the desire realm are the most inferior, thus it is called AvÄ«ci.
Such AvÄ«ci has no further excess, thus it is called AvÄ«ci.
Such AvÄ«ci has no further superiority, thus it is called AvÄ«ci.
That great hell is like above the head, there is no further substance, such is the extremely hot AvÄ«ci ground, it is also like this with no further above, thus it is called AvÄ«ci.
The ground of that AvÄ«ci is the hottest, with nothing surpassing it. Boiling red copper burns red flesh and bones, with nothing surpassing it, thus it is called AvÄ«ci.
The ground of that place is dense, thus it is called AvÄ«ci.

In that hell, fat, flesh, bones and marrow are all ablaze. The people in that hell are all ablaze, and it cannot be distinguished whether this is that person or that person. There is no finer distinction in between, thus it is called AvÄ«ci.

Just as the force of a river in the mountains is unceasing, flowing day and night, in that AvÄ«ci, one constantly experiences suffering and the force is unceasing. The suffering of that person cannot be interrupted until the eon ends, and there is no interval in between, thus it is called AvÄ«ci.

The suffering of that person is indescribable. There is a slight analogy: just as the drops of seawater cannot be counted, so too the suffering endured by the person of evil karma in the AvÄ«ci Hell cannot be counted or described. Among all places of suffering, there is none like the AvÄ«ci Hell. Because of the heavy karma, the suffering endured is also heavy.

If one commits one transgression, the suffering of that person is light. If one commits two transgressions, the body of that person becomes large, and the suffering endured is also much. In this way, all the limbs gradually grow larger, and the suffering is also like this.
Because the cause of karma is heavy, the cause of such suffering has no equal. Just as the experience of pleasant feeling has no equal in Akaniá¹£á¹­ha Heaven,
the two places of suffering and happiness are like this, above and below, all incomparable;
like this, above and below, the limits are incomparable.
Why is this?
Because of the creation of evil karma.
Because of creating evil karma, the cause resembles the effect. In hell, on the edge of hell, a similar metaphor cannot be found.
Thus, that person may be burned for one eon, or one eon less, until their evil karma is exhausted, and only then can they escape.
Because the cause is exhausted, the effect is also exhausted. Just as when fire is extinguished, its heat is also extinguished, and when the seed is lost, its sprout is also lost.
Thus, if the evil karma of the people in AvÄ«ci Hell is exhausted, without being completely rotten, they can then escape from that hell.
If they escape from there, the remaining karmic effects will cause them to be born in the needle-hole mountain ghost realm.
Once born there, hunger and thirst burn their bodies, and their bodies are like a forest burned by fire.
If they escape from there, they will be born in the animal realm as a shushouma, and will be born in feces, becoming an impure insect.

In the realm of hungry ghosts, for two hundred thousand lives, they are burned and cooked by hunger and thirst. In the animal realm, they experience two thousand lives. The remaining power of evil and unwholesome karma brings all kinds of suffering to various birthplaces.
In the animal realm, they eat various evil foods. Their minds always remember the place of killing. They are born there again and devour each other, experiencing great suffering.
If they escape that place, by the power of past karma they are born among humans, but die in the womb for five hundred lives;
again, they are born and die after birth for five hundred lives, eaten by crows;
again, they die before walking for five hundred lives.
This is the remaining karmic retribution for that evil karma.
If later the remaining karmic retribution is exhausted, in the beginningless past, the wheel of karma turns, and similar fruits are obtained, with lower, middle, and upper levels.
That bhiká¹£u, having contemplated in this way, spoke a verse, saying:
In the beginningless cycle of birth and death, the net of karma covers the world,
Whether born or dying, all are due to the causes and conditions of their own karma.
From heaven one is born in hell, from hell one is born in heaven;
From human birth one is born in the realm of hungry ghosts, from hell one is born as a hungry ghost.
Born with different powers, enjoying different pleasures,
All are born from the karma of craving, not created by an almighty being.
For innumerable eons, sentient beings in the cycle of birth and death,
Others cannot understand, only the TathÄgata knows.
He knows this karma and its causes and conditions,
Explaining to the ignorant, transforming all sentient beings.
Bhiká¹£us!

That bhiká¹£u, having observed the suffering of AvÄ«ci in this way, his mind becomes detached from all birth and death. Cultivating his mind with great compassion and right mindfulness, he attains the eleventh stage.

The earth-dwelling yakshas, knowing this, are delighted and pass on the news to the sky-dwelling yakshas. The sky-dwelling yakshas pass it on to the Four Heavenly Kings, and the Four Heavenly Kings pass it on to the Heaven of the Thirty-three, as explained before, up to the Great Brahma Heaven. They say:

In Jambudvipa, in such and such a country, in such and such a village, a good man of such and such a family has shaved off his hair and beard, put on the Dharma robes, gone forth with right faith, fought with Mara, not dwelling in Mara's realm, not delighting in defiled desires, and attained the eleventh stage.
The Great Brahma Heaven, hearing this, is delighted and says:
Mara's faction is diminished, the righteous Dharma arises, the faction of goodness increases, in accordance with the Dharma, the Dharma of the monks is established and shines.

Furthermore, the practitioner contemplates with the mind, in accordance with the true Dharma, observing the practice of the Dharma: How does that monk, having contemplated Avici, practice in accordance with it?
How does that bhiká¹£u observe the place of AvÄ«ci Hell, and how many places are there in AvÄ«ci Hell?
He sees, hears and knows:
Just like the other hells, which have sixteen places, this AvÄ«ci Hell also has sixteen places.
What are the sixteen?
The first is called Crow's Mouth;
The second is called All Directions;
The third is called Endless Suffering;
The fourth is called Jackal's Howl;
The fifth is called Iron Jackal's Food;
The sixth is called Black Belly;
The seventh is called Body Melting;
The eighth is called Dreaming of Fear;
The ninth is called Body Melting and Suffering;
The tenth is called Two Mountains;
The eleventh is called Howling and Birth of Yama, Inaccessible;
The twelfth is called Star Garland;
The thirteenth is called Intense Suffering;
The fourteenth is called Covered by Foul Odors;
The fifteenth is called Iron Sheath;
The sixteenth is called Eleven Flames.
